title: The cost of voting in a pandemic
itunes:title: The cost of voting in a pandemic
description:
Welcome to Apple News Today, a new show from Apple News. In today's episode:

USA Today and Columbia Journalism Investigations look at how states and counties are running short on funds to hold elections. 

The city of Asheville, North Carolina, takes a step toward reparations. The News & Observer has the story. And Business Insider tracks how reparations are perceived on a national scale. 

According to Scientific American, humans aren’t the only animals who practice social distancing.

And Condé Nast Traveler says Iceland is giving us all permission to scream.
